TransactionProcessingType.name: TransactionProcessingType
TransactionProcessingType.description: Represents the settings to configure the processing constraints for a request.

Description.description: The description of the transaction processing configuration to help Salesforce admins with configuration in their orgs.

DeveloperName.description: Required. The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Record Type Name.

Language.description: The language of the TransactionProcessingType object.

MasterLabel.description: The label for the TransactionProcessingType object.

PricingPreference.description: Specifies whether to execute the price calculation step for each sales transaction record. Valid values are: Force—Reprices all lines. System—Performs a delta pricing request on the unprocessed lines when Delta Pricing is enabled in the org. Skip—Skips the pricing request on all lines. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

RuleEngine.description: The rule engine to be used for processing rules.

SaveType.description: Specifies how the transaction results are processed when saved for Salesforce administrators to adjust the user experience as desired. Valid values are: Standard Large—Reserved for future use.

TaxPreference.description: Specifies whether to execute or skip the tax calculation step for each sales transaction record.
